conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be predicted whether it flows into container D or E after passing through baffles.
The image shows three liquid sources labeled A, B, and C at the top, baffles arranged in zig-zag patterns in the middle, and two containers labeled D and E at the bottom.
The baffles are angled differently, guiding liquid streams in specific directions.
The baffles deflect liquid from source A leftward overall, guiding it into container D.
The baffles deflect liquid from source B rightward overall, guiding it into container E.
The baffles deflect liquid from source C leftward overall, guiding it into container D.
Final answer: A flows into container D, B flows into container E, and C flows into container D.
